unnormalised: Hey Bollywood buffs! Grab your chai and samosas, because we've got some piping hot gossip fresh off the Mumbai streets. It’s been a whirlwind week in the land of flashing lights and impossible abs, and your friendly neighbourhood gossip monger is here to spill the beans.
normalised: Hey Bollywood buffs! Grab your chai and samosas, because we've got some piping hot gossip fresh off the Mumbai streets. It's been a whirlwind week in the land of flashing lights and impossible abs, and your friendly neighborhood gossip monger is here to spill the beans.

unnormalised: First up: Is Ranbir Kapoor back in the dating game? Rumour has it he's been spotted getting cozy with model, Anya Sharma, at a recent Diwali party in Bandra. Sources say they were inseparable all night, even sharing a plate of jalebis (aww, sweet!). Of course, Team Ranbir is denying everything, calling it just a "casual friendship." But we all know how those "friendships" tend to blossom under the Mumbai sun, don't we? Stay tuned, folks!

unnormalised: Then there's the whole Deepika-Ranveer saga. Are they having marital woes? Apparently, there were some disagreements about their Onam celebrations in Kerala. Deepika apparently wanted a traditional sadhya, while Ranveer was craving his mom’s special Hyderabadi biryani. A small tiff or a sign of something deeper? We’re keeping our eyes peeled.

unnormalised: Speaking of food, word on the street is that Alia Bhatt is taking cooking classes! Apparently, she's determined to perfect her mother-in-law's famous aloo gobi before the next family gathering. Talk about brownie points!

unnormalised: And finally, the big one: Karan Johar's next project is allegedly a remake of "Kuch Kuch Hota Hai," but with a modern twist. Rumours are swirling that Janhvi Kapoor, Ishaan Khatter, and Sara Ali Khan are in the running for the lead roles. Can you imagine the drama? The fashion! The nostalgia! It’s gonna be epic! Sources even say a dance number shot in Mysore is in the works.
